AllListingsWarning:
By deactivating personalized listings your Discover feed will be populated with random listings on the network. 
 
 Please keep in mind that these listings may contain adult or illicit content and/or photos that may be offensive. 
 
 If at any point you want to go back to viewing personalized listings, you can simply toggle the setting and your Discover feed will go back to normal.

ManualAddModeratorHelp: Enter the GUIDs of one or more moderators, separated by commas, here. The GUID is on the right side of their About tab on their page. Adding the GUID of a user that is not a moderator will have no effect, that GUID will be ignored.

PriceForOne: Price per single item, file, or service. Based on the listing's base price and the current exchange rate of BTC. This may not match the order total, which is based on the exchange rate of BTC at the time you purchased this listing.
AdditionalPaymentDataInfo: Include name of purchase and order number in payment QR code?

transactions.DisputeTransactionResendTooltip: If the other party did not receive your dispute, click this button to send it to them again.
transactions.DisputeInstructions: To file a dispute for this transaction, type the reason for the dispute below, and check the Start a Dispute box. This will include the moderator in your conversation until the dispute is resolved. The moderator will make the final decision as to whether any funds are returned to you, and how much. The moderator's fee will be paid out of the funds you have already sent.
transactions.CloseDisputeResendTooltip: If one or more of the parties involved in this dispute did not receive the dispute close message, click this button to resend the dispute resolution.
transactions.PayoutOnlyBuyer: Closing this dispute will return all of the funds to the buyer, minus the Moderator fee, because the seller has not yet given their bitcoin payout address.
transactions.UpdateFailed: Your transaction update did not complete. Open the transaction and try again
transactions.UpdateInvalid: Your transaction update returned invalid data. Open the transaction and try again

aboutSection.about:
OpenBazaar is a network of users who buy and sell goods and services directly with each other, using Bitcoin. This network is decentralized and isn't controlled by any organization.

The software is open source and MIT licensed. You can view the code on GitHub.

OpenBazaar is a community project, and we welcome participation in our Slack channel or on our subreddit.

If you need help, read the OpenBazaar version 1.0 tutorial.

If you still have questions, open an issue at our support desk.

aboutSection.support:
You can help OpenBazaar in several ways on our mission to make trade free.

Buying and selling goods and services on the network helps grow our community and make the platform more attractive to new users. Politely asking Bitcoin-accepting businesses to sell on the platform helps spread the word and shows demand for peer to peer trade.

If you're a developer, check out our GitHub and see where you can help us. Beyond helping with the core code, we hope the permissionless and open source nature of the project means you will build new services on top of the existing network.

You can also donate Bitcoin to the project, which will be used to defray costs for visiting conferences, offering bounties for development, and promoting OpenBazaar.

Please join our Slack if you have new ideas for OpenBazaar, or have questions for the core devs.

discover.noResults: No listings found in your network
discover.noTaggedResults: No listings found in your network tagged with

onboarding.IntroductionBody:
OpenBazaar is a peer-to-peer social market. It's like combining eBay™, Twitter™ and BitTorrent into one. Only, there are no fees or restrictions and OpenBazaar is open-source. 

 Please note that it may look and feel a bit different than what you're used to, so please be patient as you adjust.
onboarding.theme: Select a Theme for your Page
onboarding.contributors: %{smart_count} 'ach yIn nuvpu' 'Iv ghaq |||| %{smart_count} 'ach yIn nuvpu' 'Iv ghaq
onboarding.disclaimer_body:
OpenBazaar Doch chavmoH Hoch wo' SabtaHbogh yIn nuvpu'-bitcoin-lo' Hutlh vay' Vas DIvI' ravDaq yISeH 'ej mech network. SoHvaD ngoy' activity wa' nuv. qej 

OpenBazaar nuv wej Sovbe'lu'bogh Qoylu' 'ej mIv tIn vItuQchoH pong quvHa' nuvpu'. QaD QumpIn SabtaHbogh nuvpu' mI' pong, 'ach public vaj laH nuq Davang wa' nuv maqochpu'na' maHtaH ip SoQ. De' laH DanoHmeH nuv quvHa' harm SoH; ghob'e' vIchIDmeH, Qatlh Qu' QaD HoS.

The OpenBazaar group of men who build has worked hard to deliver a free floor for trade to the world. But as with any work, bugs will be found. The men who build are not responsible for any money lost associated with problems in the work.

By using OpenBazaar you're responsible for your own honor on the OpenBazaar people.

onboarding.discoverCallOut: Explore Listings and Pages on OpenBazaar

guidStillCreating.YourPersonal:
Your personal keys and OpenBazaar ID are generating and should only take about 30 seconds to finish.

You'll be automatically connected to the network once the process is finished, so please hang tight.
guidStillCreating.LookingFor: Looking for something to do in the meantime? Read the OpenBazaar blog.

walletProviders.CoinbaseTagline: The world's most popular way to buy, sell, and use bitcoin.
walletProviders.SamouraiTagline: Secure mobile wallet. Emphasis on privacy.
walletProviders.BreadwalletTagline: Connects directly to the bitcoin network, no servers. Beautiful simplicity, maximum security.
walletProviders.RushWalletTagline: Get a Bitcoin address quickly and easily in your browser.
walletProviders.MyceliumTagline: One of the longest in market, most secure and reliable Bitcoin wallets.
walletProviders.BlockchaininfoTagline: The world's most popular bitcoin wallet. Safer, Friendlier, Easier.
walletProviders.DuoMoneyTagline: Euro wallet for dead-easy Bitcoin payments. OpenBazaar for Grandma.
walletProviders.BitGoTagline: The world's most secure bitcoin wallet. Trusted by leading Bitcoin businesses.

serverConnectModal.intro: OpenBazaar is designed to allow you to host your server separate from the client. By default, your server will run locally, but you can override it below.
